intro: Hieracium longiceps, commonly known as the long-headed hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its flowers are yellow with a central disk, and the leaves are lance-shaped with rough textures. Hieracium longiceps is often found in open areas where it can compete effectively with other herbs.
